fields.name: Dark
fields.description: A family saga with a supernatural twist, set in a German town, where the disappearance of two young children exposes the relationships among four families.
fields.review: I loved this from show from a technical perspective. The HDR drone shots in a forest reveal that this is a series that could only have been filmed in 2017. It's always hard to depict the supernatural without cringeworthy VFX, but Dark does a really good job keeping the viewer on their toes about what's going to happen next.

fields.name: Mindhunter
fields.description: In the late 1970s two FBI agents expand criminal science by delving into the psychology of murder and getting uneasily close to all-too-real monsters.
fields.review: Looking back at it, it wasn't that special, but nonetheless I was hooked from the Fincher-directed first episode. Mindhunter follows 2 FBI agents trying to get into the minds of serial killers. This series reminded me of one of my favorite films ever: _The Zodiac_. I wouldn't mind a second season.

fields.name: Easy
fields.description: Intertwined groups of friends in Chicago fumble through the modern maze of love, sex, technology and culture.
fields.review: If ”Master of None” is too American hipster for you, you're definitely going to hate this one. For me, the snackable 30 minute episodes were perfect TV material to wind down after a busy day. I love that Marc Maron plays in this show, and honestly, the writing is pretty good.

fields.name: Narcos
fields.description: A chronicled look at the criminal exploits of Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar, as well as the many other drug kingpins who plagued the country through the years.
fields.review: My first thought when this was announced was: do we really need a season 3? Didn't the story kind of conclude in season 2? However, upon watching, I am happy I got to see this. We get introduced to interesting new characters and overall this was one of the shows I enjoyed the most this year. If you missed S1 and S2, definitely start from the beginning!

fields.name: Game of Thrones
fields.description: ine noble families fight for control over the mythical lands of Westeros, while a forgotten race returns after being dormant for thousands of years.
fields.review: With season 6 I thought I was done with GoT, but nonetheless I really enjoyed season 7. Some of the special FX in the S7 episodes bring GoT on par with the biggest Hollywood movies. I've never been one for investigating the backstory on this one and I am happy for that, because I'm sure they've butchered what was left of the original saga. Now you just take GoT for what it is: high-budget mindless entertainment that has its moments.

fields.name: Master of None
fields.description: The personal and professional life of Dev, a 30-year-old actor in New York.
fields.review: This seems to be quite polarizing, where some people think this is VERY boring and others think it's brilliant. I'm in the brilliant camp. This is like a romantic comedy but not as dumb, and in a series format that actually makes sense to tell an extended story.

fields.name: Black Mirror
fields.description: An anthology series exploring a twisted, high-tech world where humanity's greatest innovations and darkest instincts collide.
fields.review: Even though Black Mirror S4 has only just released, I know it's going to be great based on the previous seasons. Every episode is a story on its own, showing the audience a dystopian version of the future where if you're really honest, you realize part of it is already here.
